document.docTitle: Tricorythodes biluhue Emmerich & Molineri 2020, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Tricorythodes Ulmer (Ephemeroptera: Leptohyphidae) from Uruguay

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Tricorythodes Ulmer (Ephemeroptera: Leptohyphidae) from Uruguay

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–2.
Tricorythodes biluhue
sp. nov.
Nymph: 1, habitus; 2, idem variation.

FIGURES 3–14.
Tricorythodes biluhue
sp. nov.
Nymph: 3, labrum, dorsal view (d.v.) right, ventral view (v.v.) left; 4, distal margin of labrum, d.v; 5, distal margin of labrum, v.v; 6, right maxilla, v.v and detail of palp; 7, left maxilla, v. v. arrow indicates detail of palp; 8, detail of maxillary palp, v.v. (figures 6–8 from different specimens); 9, hypopharynx, d.v., arrow indicates spine on inner margin of superlingua; 10, labium, v.v (left with setae, right setae omitted); 11, foreleg, d.v.; 12, fore tarsal claw; 13, middle tibia; 14, hind leg, d.v.

FIGURES 15–24.
Tricorythodes biluhue
sp. nov.
Nymph: 15, pronotum and part of mesonotum, lateral view; 16, pronotum (only right half), d.v.; 17, abdominal sterna III–IX; 18, opercular gill, d.v.; 19, opercular gill, v.v; 20–23, gills III–VI, v.v. Male imago: 24, genitalia, v.v.

subSubSection.paragraph: Length (mm): Body, 4.8–5.0, Fore wing, 5.0–5.5, Caudal filaments, 13.0, Terminal filament, 14.0–18.5.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 25–28.
Tricorythodes biluhue
sp. nov.
Male imago: 25, dorsal habitus; 26, ventral habitus; 27, hind leg, d.v.; 28, egg.

subSubSection.paragraph: Female imago. Length (mm): Body, 5.5, Forewing, 6.8. Coloration as in male except abdomen plenty of orangish eggs.

Distribution.
T. biluhue
sp. nov.
has a wide distribution in Uruguay as shown in figure 29.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 29. Map with distributional ranges of the three species of
Tricorythodes
known from Uruguay.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Etymology. The epithet
biluhue
comes from the charrua language ”bilú hue” and means ”beautiful water”. We want to dedicate this species to the Uruguayan people and the Franciscan Family of this country who are demanding the repeal of the recently irrigation law that violates the human and biotic right to water.
